timeline.bodyText: Since UTF8_INTERN_TABLE is not an LRU cache, I think component will be the only case where the tag will likely be interned (thanks to DDComponents). Is this intentional? Should we extend this to other values?
timeline.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: span types are also interned. Again, I don't think an LRU cache as opposed to an immutable constant pool is the right abstraction here because these lookups go into a CPU intensive pipeline, any concurrency control will slow these lookups down.
replies.author: richardstartin

replies.bodyText: Span types are not added with this method, so I think component will be the only thing that applies.
replies.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: That's deceiving... after the trace is finished but before serializing it gets removed as a tag and set as a field: https://github.com/DataDog/dd-trace-java/blob/master/dd-trace-core/src/main/java/datadog/trace/core/processor/rule/SpanTypeRule.java
